location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 821 of 1866 from Charles Gonne, Secretary to Government, Political Department, Bombay Castle to Lieutenant-Colonel Lewis Pelly, Political Resident in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: Letter remarking on Pelly's 'coolness, judgement and courage' in conducting himself when securing the safety, lives and property of British Subjects following the death of Sayed Towaynee [Thuwaini bin Said] and the rescue of Sayed Torkee [Turki bin Said].The letter goes on to request that Pelly clarify whether he requires any further assistance in recovering the British Subjects property and on the appropriate language for the Government to use in responding to the Wahabees [Wahhabi].A draft copy of Charles Gonne's subsequent letter, No. 822, is given at the bottom of the verso of folio 69. The official copy of this letter can be found on the verso of folio 68.
